title: Farnham Display Reg. Swash problems overlapping
content:
Hi guys, i have a problem with the end of the lowercase ’k’ and the ’f’ (or the ’fi’-ligature for that matter) overlapping.

How would you solve it?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [farnham\_k](http://web.archive.org/web/20071213045209/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%201_103.png) | 33.49 KB |

 [‹ Sans companion for Joanna](http://web.archive.org/web/20071213045209/http:/typophile.com/node/40010 "Go to previous forum topic") [Help picking typefaces ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071213045209/http:/typophile.com/node/39983 "Go to next forum topic")
author: cuidado

comments.content: There is an alternative k, is it not?
yes, i’d use the k from the regular italic font.

I’m stupid!

Somehow my brain refused to think of the idea of using the regular italic font.

Sorry for a very stupid question and thanks for the answer :)
